website_summaries.verdict: One of the best all-around road tires on the market, whether for touring, racing, or commuting.
pros: Sturdy and fairly rugged for a road tire
Resists flats of all kinds, whether from punctures or sidewall splits
Rolls smooth and isn’t too heavy
Reflective strip is functional and stylish
cons: Fits tightly to rims, making installation tough and requiring tire levers and elbow grease
May be vulnerable to snakebite (pinch) flats at lower p.s.i

customer_reviews.title: Great, Overall Road Tire - Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great tire, very reliable, good in all weather situations. Does well with punctures, unless you encounter goat heads (pictured) which are typically found in the southwestern states. **I've been a road cyclist for 6 years, and have done various bike rides throughout the country and abroad.
customer_reviews.author: hhfoco

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THESE
customer_reviews.text: I bought one in Feb 2018 and had a major sidewalk blow out in Dec 2018- got 10 months out of them. Contentals rep managed to convince me I ran over invisible road debris so I bought a second one. I rode 80 miles on baby smooth pavement and had the sidewall rip on me. It was a slow rip so I didn’t have a total failure. I emailed them to complain and they don’t admit to having batch issues but they REALLY NEED TO RECALL ALL THE TIRES IN THE LAST YEAR! I’ve had Grand Prix since 2012 and this is the first I’m having this issue. Assholes.
customer_reviews.author: Su Z Q

customer_reviews.title: Blowout & three flats in a month
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these Continental tires a month ago. In that time I have had a blowout and three flat tires. This is on the same route I've been riding for two or three years with a flat maybe every few months. Either Continentals aren't as good as everyone says or these aren't real Continentals. To add insult to injury, since I returned one for replacement after it blew out the second time I rode on it, Amazon will only allow me to get a refund for one of the tires so I'm out the cost of the second useless tire.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Much larger than 25mm
customer_reviews.text: These tires feel great, but run very tall and wide. I usually ride 700x23 and decided to upgrade to the 700x25 but they rub on the top of my fork. When measuring them, they were about 27.5mm and that's on a 23mm wheel. I did not want 28s and will have to go back to the 23s.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Guyler

customer_reviews.title: Great tires
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my wife's bike. She had been using some Vittoria Open Corsa EVO tires but the current Vittoria offering has natural/gumwall sides and she didn't like that look so I ordered the Conti tires as we've both used them in the past and been happy with their performance and lifespan. They've generally been easy tires to mount up (the Vittorias can be quite tight on some rims). As for the seller, I had a very quick and easy transaction.
customer_reviews.author: John DeWald

customer_reviews.title: Grippy but horrible sidewalls - both tires had sidewall explosions within a month of each other
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tires due to the rave reviews that they had. They worked great however the tire's sidewalls seem susceptible to exploding. Even at proper inflation. I looked it up online after the 2nd tire blew up only to find that many other people have had the same issue. For now, I'm moving back to gatorskins but if I'm going to get competitive tires, I might move over to Michelins...
customer_reviews.author: Karthak

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! Sidewall shears at less than 500 miles
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Conti brand for the better part of 2 decades and have never had so many problems. In a single ride (after 500 miles of tire wear) I had 5 sidewall shears and four flats on a group ride. I was the only person to flat all day. Also, one of the two tire was a same model/make replacement from a blowout that sheared the kevlar bead. These maybe single "race day" clinchers but, I'd save your entry fee and buy something else. Very disappointing weave Conti!
customer_reviews.author: crussell929

customer_reviews.title: These continue to be my favorite tire
customer_reviews.text: Prices seem good right now - maybe because of the release of the GP5000, so I just got myself a spare. These tires rate superbly for rolling and puncture resistance, and last very well. I got almost 3000 miles out of my first one of these 28mm tires. One caveat is that like all GP4000s, they run large. These 28mm tires shape up at close to 30.5mm on my Specialized rims, which have a 16.2mm inner spacing. Even for me, I have only about 1mm clearance to my seat stay bridge on my 2016 Roubaix, but this has not caused me any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Camp RunamokTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: My fancy tires were wearing out and I needed something to replace them. I wanted something I could get on and off without using a chisel, something that promised to be long lasting, something that would be suitable on roads and gravel surfaces, and something that wouldn't add lots of weight to my bike. Finding these on sale was the answer I was hoping for. Myself, I wouldn't have bought these at full price, but I happily got them at a discount. Worth waiting for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sixbey

customer_reviews.title: Great tires
customer_reviews.text: Real good tires. I bought them November of 2017, so it's now 7 months and about 3,000 miles. Last week I rotated the tires and it looks like there is still some millage left on them. The tires are fast but also very resistant to sharp objects - I did have a few flats which are expected but no blow-ups like I frequently experienced with the tires i used before. My weight is 168 pounds and I inflate the tires to 95PSI front and 90PSI rear which seems to work well with comfort and rolling resistance. When it's time to get new tires I'm going to purchase Continental GP 4000II again.
customer_reviews.author: REL99

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit  Oval 327 disc 25mm well
customer_reviews.text: This tire is way too much trouble to get on a Fuji Oval 25mm tire as it is too tight. The stock tires 25mm that came with bike were easy to take on and off. I have pinched too many tubes trying to get it on with tire levers. This never happened with other 25mm tires. I have this same Conti tire as a 28mm on my back and it fits fine. I have a 28mm on that was on the front, but clearance caused bits of gravel to scratch fork, so I went back to 25mm on front.
customer_reviews.author: Maltesefalcon

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to be riding on anything other than perfect surfaces, buy the Gatorskins. I have less than 500 miles on them and I'm already having to replace. They did increase my speed though. Reading other reviews, it looks like they had a quality control issue for a while. Why were the Bondrager Race Lites discontinued? I had 5000 miles on them before my first flat and less than 500 on these. Update: just this morning the sidewall blew out on one of the tires. Virtually new tube and tire destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hall

customer_reviews.title: Tire was slightly out of round.
customer_reviews.text: The tire was a bit larger than the last tires ( same kind) and rubbed the paint, etc off the underside of the fork. Was REALLY bad and annoying if it was wet, or picked up bits of gravel sticking to the tire. Then it sounded like it was doing REAL damage. It eventually wore down over the summer but I’ve not experienced this when buying from the LBS and I’ve been riding a long time.
customer_reviews.author: DMitz

customer_reviews.title: Great tires
customer_reviews.text: I live in Colorado and we have lots of goatheads around here. I wanted some tires that held up fairly well to punctures but didn't feel like I was running steel belts while pedaling uphill. I have been using these tires for roughly 3 seasons and am very happy with them. I noticed at first that I was still flatting with them but when I am diligent about keeping the pressure up (I run them at 115), they perform much better. I can generally get ~7,000 miles per tire unless I roll over a hazard and get a slice (it's only happened once).
customer_reviews.author: Craig E. Poley

customer_reviews.title: These are AWESOME, long-lasting tires!
customer_reviews.text: Besides the tires that came on the bike, these are the only ones I've used. Some people say you get 3-4K miles out of tires. I just rotated my tires again, & the one I pulled off the rear (due to a few wear spots in the now-worn-flat center) has 9,402 miles on it. The one before had 7,262 miles, & the one before that had 12,042 miles! Yes, 12 THOUSAND miles. Needless to say, I LOVE the Conti 4000s II's & HIGHLY recommend them. You can usually buy them for $35-42 each. Mom sent me a 2-pack at Christmas for $81.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W

customer_reviews.title: Been racing on them for years
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite racing tires by a long shot. The 25mm tires work perfectly with most modern rims sand line up with perfect flushness. Their only downfall is big pieces of metal or debris in the road, and I've gashed more than a few on training rides. If your riding takes you through industrial zones or onto gravel you might look for something a bit more robust. Although, I have used these year-round without any issues in the past (4Seasons work a bit better for tire puncture resistance and don't roll that much slower).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Clinchers
customer_reviews.text: I've used most of the Top Brand/Models, and the 4000sII is my favorite clinchers. I use them for commuting, crit & road racing. Great mileage with very limited amount of flats. Most flats occurs when the tire is at it's end of life. Good traction in the wet, rolls fast, pretty comfortable, etc. I guess the only negative is the strength of the side walls. Every so often I'll slice the side wall, and the tire needs to be replaced. Seems to happen more often then other tires I've used
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Sidewall blowout, very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Within the first 15 miles, I had a sidewall blowout that sounded like a gunshot. The tires were inflated to 90 psi, and I did not run over debris. The tire was mounted properly - the bead was still intact after the sidewall blew a hole thru itself. Simply a manufacturing defect. Very disappointing, especially for such an expensive tire.
customer_reviews.author: NJgreyhead

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I replaced an older set of Conti Grand ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I replaced an older set of Conti Grand Prix with these and it rides like a new bike! These are incredibly smooth rolling, don't weigh a ton, and are pretty stout as far as puncture resistance. The tread is long-wearing and is grippy, even in the rain. My new favorite tire! By the way, these measure a bit wider than their listed size, so if you have a tight frame to tire clearance, consider that these are a couple mm wider and higher than their listed size (true for 23 and 25mm sizes anyway).
customer_reviews.author: RCC

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control!
customer_reviews.text: New tire in plastic bag. Sidewall defective. Immediately noticeable as I started to mount on rim. BIG disappointment, losing riding time. This is supposed to be a premium tire! Interestingly, the second tire I ordered came in a separate shipment and was in a Continental OEM box. It was definitely a superior tire --ithe better quality was immediately noticeable! The replacement tire I ordered from Amazon came in an OEM Continental box and is of good quality. What happened Amazon?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tires
customer_reviews.text: I previously was running the Schwalbe Luganos on my Cannondale as they come stock the bike. I never had a problem with the Luganos but decided to upgrade to the Gran Prix 4000sII. What a difference the tires seem to roll better, they seem to absorb impacts and road imperfections, and they are much quieter. They also seem to have much better traction. Time will tell how they hold up but for now im happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: jmullen0120

customer_reviews.title: 200 miles and the tires have been holding up great. I decided to try 25mm up from 23mm ...
customer_reviews.text: All i seen were positive reviews before purchase but after install now I'm seeing some negative reviews. I,m now concerned with sidewall issues but some of the guys and gals I ride with have the same tires with no issues, should be okay. So far, 200 miles and the tires have been holding up great. I decided to try 25mm up from 23mm and it has changed feel of ride. The wheels feel very hollow and make a lot of rolling noise, kinda like jeep or suv tires. i have 115 psi. thus far, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: R S H

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire, Great Response, Okay-ish Durability
customer_reviews.text: One of the best bike tires money can buy, but make sure your riding path isn't too severe. These provide better control than almost any other tire I've used. However, if your bike paths aren't all paved, your roads are questionable in their quality, you run over debris a lot, or you live where chip seal roads are common, these tires may not provide the durability you need. To summarize, one of the best tires but you need a clear riding path because durability isn't equal to something like Gatorskins.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I ordered 2, one of them was not the tire I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I am very displeased with my purchase. One tire was fine, but the other looks completely different and is starting to fray and come apart after one ride. There are gashes in it and and parts are starting to bulge. I don't know why they sent me two different tires. *Edit* - I'm a huge idiot. The tire was fine. FYI, it shouldn't be used inside out...
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kim

customer_reviews.title: They ride well, corner well, and handle wet pavement well too.
customer_reviews.text: I've been riding these tires for about 3 months and 1,000 miles. I have had no flats and have found them to be excellent in all respects. They ride well, corner well, and handle wet pavement well too. I have tried 5-6 different tires over the past 8 years and this is the first time I have tried the Continentals. I would rate them in the top 2 of all the tires I have tried. They easily out distance all but one other tire that I've tried and they seem to be the equal of the tire that I have trusted most for the past 3 years. I recommend that you give these a try. They will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Roy H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tires for you Road Bike!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Cannondale Synapse to replace the really poor quality OEM Lugano tires and these are superb! I had several flats with the Lugano but just completed the 180 mile Trek Across Maine on some pretty tough roads and was the only one in our group that didn't have a flat! (I did break a spoke but that is another matter.....) I would definitely recommend these and will buy them again when my tires need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Water Bob

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sidewalls. My rear tire simply burst (3 mm ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible sidewalls. My rear tire simply burst (3 mm split) with 100 lbs air. And no, I didn't run over anything. That small section is actually thinner than the rest of the sidewall; like paper thin. Never seen a defect like that on any tire. $50 down the tubes...no pun intended. Going back to Vittoria Pro Slicks. Never had any issues with the Pro Slicks, and I have been through about 8 sets.
customer_reviews.author: Beastmtb

customer_reviews.title: Best road bike tires
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these tires for the past 15 years and they are the best tires for my road bike. Used to buy 700 x 23, but moved up to the 700 x 25 a few years ago. Love the wear indicators that let you know when to replace them. Have about 5000 miles on my current ones.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: One side wall blew out on 3rd ride. The look great and ride nicely but after the side wall gave way after less than 150 miles I read that it's a common problem. I moved the tire to use as a trainer tire for the winter to get some use out of it. The original mavic tires that looked flimsy lasted 2000 miles. Maybe I had bad luck, road sides are not the cleanest surfaces. I will try another brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: First Ride: Sidewall Failure
customer_reviews.text: I took these tires out for the first time the other day and had a major blowout in the middle of my 100 mile ride. Had to stop at a shop and buy a entire new tire as the entire sidewall tore. I had to use a cliffbar wrapper to cover the gaping hole and put in a new tube to get to the shop. I really enjoyed the 50 miles that I rode, however. I was surprised by how little rolling resistance they had. I am switching to gatorskin tires and see if that helps. I wish they were just a tad bit stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Fast rolling tires
customer_reviews.text: Some people complain about getting alot of flats with these, so far I only have 100 miles on them but no flats and the roads here are horrible. They are comfy, they roll fast..it is probably going to be my go to tire for now unless i start experiencing an unusual amount of flats as some have. So far..so good. Love em
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Waters

customer_reviews.title: 28mm tire strectches with time and no longer fits on frames for 28mm tires
customer_reviews.text: When new, tire fits on a 2012 Cannodale Synapse. After a couple of weeks, the tire estrechess and barely fits on a bike designed to take 28mm tires. This happened to two different 28mm tires, one purchased on Amazon, the second purchased at the LBS. I did also purchase the 25mm version but it got a 1/2 inch tear after riding over a 1/2 inch pothole.
customer_reviews.author: JuanCho

customer_reviews.title: Best tires for most road cyclists, came fast, good price
customer_reviews.text: I am a recreational road cyclist (100-200 miles per week). I don't race but I like to go as fast as I can. These are the best tires I have ever used. These came fast. The tires feel great, they mounted ok, and I really like them and will order again when I need new ones.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dryer

customer_reviews.title: ... Seasons and GP4000s II in 25mm and they were great, the 28mm that I got must of been ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had GP 4 Seasons and GP4000s II in 25mm and they were great, the 28mm that I got must of been a bad lot or counterfeit as I had to return one because of a bad bead and the replacement blew out the sidewall with less then 200 miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice update to previous verson
customer_reviews.text: I had the Grand Prix 4000 and liked the feel on my bike. These are a slight upgrade, though I can hardly tell. Still handle great and no issues. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: D. Fogel

customer_reviews.title: Still the Best All-Around Road Tire you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I've been riding Continental Grand Prix 4000s tires since college, training, racing, everything. Best all around tire and the 4000s II are more of the same. These were my first time on 25c instead of the normal 23c. Never thought I needed a more comfortable ride, but now that I have the better ride of the 25c I don't think I could switch back to 23c.
customer_reviews.author: Redraiderguy08

customer_reviews.title: which is fine so stick to about 115psi
customer_reviews.text: I am a heavier rider so I prefer a higher psi. The max psi on these tires is 120, which is fine so stick to about 115psi. You can immediately feel how fast, smooth and comfortable these tires are. I went with the 25mm width after doing some research on the rolling resistance difference between 23m and 25mm. 25mm has a lower rolling resistance. I bought one tire for my rear wheel as a trial. after 20-ish miles i went right back to Amazon to order a second one for my front tire. I highly recommend these tires.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great set of tires for your Bike
customer_reviews.text: These tires are great. Found them to ride faster than previous tires. I had this tire on my bike now for a week. Notice a difference in the tire when riding. Tread wear easy to locate. Going to buy them again for my new bike. Original box and tires when I receive them. Recommended for going faster.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: These tires are great. I've been running the same tire in a ...
customer_reviews.text: These tires are great. I've been running the same tire in a 23, but the ride quality is significantly better, as the same rolling resistance can be had at a lower pressure. There are some claims that these tires have some puncture resistance, but I can't say I get any less flats than I do on any other tire, but you aren't buying this tire for that, you're buying it for traction, handling, and wear. The last set of Conti's lasted me 4,000 miles. I'll stick with them until something better comes out.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great tires, never let me down.
customer_reviews.text: Used a different tire for the summer and hated every minute. Finally went back to my Continental 400S ll. I should never have tried a different tire. So far I have 500 plus miles on these tires and zero flats. Riding in excessive heat in Las Vegas summer and rain in Canada. Never let me down. Great tires.
customer_reviews.author: Neutronman

customer_reviews.title: Continental Grand Prix 400 IIs Folding Bicycle Tire
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best racing/training bicycle clincher tires. Very well made. They mount easily and provide a smooth, humpless rotation and ride. Very popular among my cycling buddies. I use standard weight Continental Race 28 Tubes and experience very few flats, ridding lots of miles per year.
customer_reviews.author: John M Lapoint

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughbred
customer_reviews.text: Maybe there's a full-on ultimate race tire that's better. But at this price point and for a couple thousand miles a year of fast fitness riding that I do, I love these tires! Grippy as hell in the corners. Rolls very well inflated at 115 PSI (I'm 175 lbs 6' 1") I've punctured twice in the 3 seasons I've been using these and each time was running over broken glass that I couldn't avoid or something like that. Day to day riding with day to day hazards ... this tire keeps rolling on with no trouble even with a lighter race type tube. Great road feel too.
customer_reviews.author: MitchWTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 700 miles.
customer_reviews.text: These tires felt great to ride on, but they simply weren't durable. For reference, my bike's stock Espoir tires lasted me a few thousand miles, but these needed to be replaced much sooner than that in the same road conditions. Got a few flats, and (like others have said) some substantial chunks taken out of the tire. Not sure if it's a quality control issue, or just that the tires are lacking in durability.
customer_reviews.author: Blaser

customer_reviews.title: Great tires but delicate sidewalls.
customer_reviews.text: Great tires but the sidewalls are apparently made out of tissue paper. Tire tread is very durable and resistant to punctures but unfortunately the sidewalls seem to be the weak link. I've had to ditch a couple of otherwise fine tires due to premature sidewall failure. On the positive side I've had no flats in over 3k miles using these tires.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzguitarist

customer_reviews.title: Quality tire.
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my second set of these tires. The first set lasted 3500 miles and were retired due to sidewall abrasions that had started to cut into the tire. This has been mentioned by previous posters as a weak spot. They are fast tires but tend to square off fairly quickly. Only one flat at 3500 miles caused by a goat head. They require little effort to mount on the rim and can be done by hand without levers. Pretty good tire for the price. If you shop around you can get a pair for $85. I'll continue to use these tires until something better comes along.
customer_reviews.author: JBanker

customer_reviews.title: best balance of rolling resistance vs. puncture resistance
customer_reviews.text: The standard in road tires, these have perhaps the best balance of low rolling resistance against puncture resistance. They feel very responsive to me. The price yo-yos a lot but has been trending up overall. The next time I see a really good price I'm inclined to stock up.
customer_reviews.author: Huey PelgerTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Weak Sidewalls
customer_reviews.text: Just a couple hundred miles and the sidewall blew out. Second one I had with the same problem. The quality control seems to have dropped. Never had this problem before.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R

customer_reviews.title: Conti make great tires. The 4000s is no exception
customer_reviews.text: Conti make great tires. The 4000s is no exception, this version seems to wear well and has decent puncture protection. When paired with latex tubes you almost get that Tubular feel. Not quite but almost. The 4000s seems a little slow when new until you wear the mold release off, after that it feels pretty good with good road feedback and cornering confidence. the rear seems to hold well when out of the saddle sprinting or climbing. The Tubular version is almost as good.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Bike Tire
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the ride of these tires, have about 1000 miles on them so far and they don't show any wear to speak of. Also have used the Schwalbe One tires and would be equally happy with either tire.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2468

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the best all round tire for my road ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the best all round tire for my road bikes that are used for commuting, club rides or training. The 25mm tire has a 29.3mm actual width my American Classic Argent wheelset (23mm rim width) and a 27mm actual width on a 23mm width H+ Son Archetype rims. These last about 4000 miles including my commute on some rough roads and are pretty good in the rain and wet roads.
customer_reviews.author: vasuvius

customer_reviews.title: What else would you expect from Conti?
customer_reviews.text: Still the riding benchmark all other tires try to live up to! Went with 25s this year...the pros are doing it so why shouldn't I? A little more comfortable. 1000 miles in, 0 flats. Unteenth pair of Contis! Same great tires. Conti do not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: but either way I'm completely happy with this tire so far
customer_reviews.text: This tire was the first time I've put a 700x25 on as opposed to a 700x23, so I'm not sure how much of the improved ride comes from the tire itself and how much comes from the larger size, but either way I'm completely happy with this tire so far. Granted I've only put a handful of rides in on them so far, it's only March here and the roads haven't been swept yet and they've thus far held up perfectly. I recommend this tire.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Best road tires hands down!
customer_reviews.text: One if not the best road tires out on the market. Tough durability. Longevity is dependent on weight and road conditions like any other tire. My go to tires hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Raul B Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Nice tire - durable and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tire that would be durable on long rides and minimize the flats I was getting with others I've tried. Compared it to the Bontrager hard case and, while the Bont seemed to have a much "cushier/softer" ride, this Conti 4000s had traction that was just as good and better long-term durability. I have around 3000 thousand miles on the set I purchased last year and, while not completely worn out yet, I decided to replace them with the same tire this season.
customer_reviews.author: JD in Rochester

customer_reviews.title: The standard for a quality lightweight/race tire.
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but good luck with these tires, they are fast rolling, light weight, and pretty long lasting for the amount of grip they offer. I've never gotten a flat with these tires and I run them roadside where I've seen glass and other sharp objects. Sometimes dodging these objects are unavoidable. Luckily I've never gottten a flat because of that. I'm curious what has changed in the SII's. I guess I'll find out in a few thousand miles when these wear out!
customer_reviews.author: thecman02

customer_reviews.title: Seem to have good sticky rubber like advertised
customer_reviews.text: Was hard to get to seat correctly the first time I put them on, but they fit once they loose the shape of the box they came in. Trained and raced for a century and no flats which is the main reason I bought them. Seem to have good sticky rubber like advertised. Cornered well. I've always rode 23mm and was recommended to go to 25mm for the longer race. Can't say I see or feel much difference. Will continue to use them till they start getting thin.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Neighbor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tires
customer_reviews.text: Been riding on the 23mm for years, found the 25mm to be as fast if not faster (larger contact patch)and a slightly more comfortable ride as well. The black chili compound is fantastically grippy and roll with the lowest reaistance of about any racing tire on the market.
customer_reviews.author: RidesHighAtNight

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire!!!
customer_reviews.text: Been riding on these tires all summer (1000+ miles) and these wheels have held up great. The ride is smooth and tackier than the gators they replaced. Durability has been good showing little signs of wear and no flats or blowouts.
customer_reviews.author: EnvoyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable tires it took me two or three rides to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable tires it took me two or three rides to get the air pressure right I weigh 170 pounds and put 80 psi in the back and 70 in the front very comfortable and I see no change in my speed I think I'm faster
customer_reviews.author: Kim Bramsen

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement
customer_reviews.text: These replaced the original Schwalbe Lugano tires that came on my 2015 Cannondale Synapse. The reduced rolling resistance improved my average speed by at least 3-5 percent. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Sheetoo

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a trainer or everyday tire. Perfect fit and easy to install. Not so tight you can’t get them on.
customer_reviews.author: Skips Warren

customer_reviews.title: Well done continental.
customer_reviews.text: These tires offer comfort and stability that is immediately apparent upon throwing a leg over the bike. I was hoping they would roll faster too, than my 23mm gatorskins. For now, they appear to be a slower rolling tire by a mph per hr. or two. This is a subjective assessment though, since I've just one ride on em after a whole week off the bike. Will post back with further review and may give them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Russell B.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Ran the 23mm version and I will admit that the tire rolls well but I've gotten 2 sidewall tears on these. One happened during a race that got me a DNF. I weigh around 140lbs too. I moved up to the 25mm version so let's see how that goes. Other than this, I normally ride on Gatorskins so I never have to worry about flats. Overall it's a good tire.
customer_reviews.author: WangDanger

customer_reviews.title: My go to tire!
customer_reviews.text: I found this tire many years ago and have never changed. It has a smooth ride and rarely flats. It is fast!
customer_reviews.author: Mark12

customer_reviews.title: Great tires, as I've installed these on many
customer_reviews.text: Great tires, as I've installed these on many, MANY Bikes. This pair, however, had one that was WAY SMALL and getting it on the rim was the fight of the century.
customer_reviews.author: smhpinehurst

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite tires for speed on the roadbike
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite tires for speed on the roadbike. They're surprisingly durable for such a light/fast tire. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic handling and good longevity
customer_reviews.text: GP4000s II tires handle great and are pretty long lasting. Not as bullet proof as Gatorskins but faster rolling and better handling. My go-to tire nowadays for road use.
customer_reviews.author: davido

customer_reviews.title: Tires are great! They are direction so make sure you look ...
customer_reviews.text: Tires are great! They are direction so make sure you look closely at the side to see which way they go on. Very light and helped improve my speed.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Galbreath

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Put these on and noticed an immediate improvement in rolling resistance. Did a 65 mile ride and tires held up great.
customer_reviews.author: Fuquar

customer_reviews.title: Continental 4000s11
customer_reviews.text: While continental did make the new 5000 series tire I still believe the 4000 to be the best all around bike tire
customer_reviews.author: John rios

customer_reviews.title: I love these tires and have had them on two bikes
customer_reviews.text: I love these tires and have had them on two bikes. Actually removed the 28c GP Race Sport tires that came stock with my bike and put these on. Despite being only 25c they actually feel smoother. If you enjoy riding fast do yourself a favor and get these. You can feel the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Get outside

customer_reviews.title: Smooth ride
customer_reviews.text: The installation was not the easiest to start since they are packaged in a small box, they do have some creases. Once you get going though it’s as simple as any other tire. Th ride is smooth and grippy. I really needed tires and didn’t want to cheap out and regret it. If your looking for tires that are worth the price, stick to Continental and make them Grand Prix 4000s’s!
customer_reviews.author: Bert Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: These are nice tires...
customer_reviews.text: ...grippy, sturdy, and smooth riding. I've only put about 500 miles on them at this point, but no flats, and a very smooth, confident ride. My previous tires on this bike (Bontrager R3 700X23) were experiencing flats quite frequently and wore very quickly - under 500 miles to squared off tread. I'd had good luck with them before, so I was very disappointed. I want to get the 25mm version now for another bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Nepon-sixt

customer_reviews.title: Very good tire!!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this tire from another company’s tire. It was different types of tire, but this company’s tire feels more stronger against flat tire and more grip to road and some detail function in tire.
customer_reviews.author: shoji

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if I caused this or if it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I caused this or if it was defective. But the side of the tire bulged shortly after I put this on my bike during an ironman race. It almost ruined my race so I won't be buying these again. To be fair, I could have caused this so I'll give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ruffstone

customer_reviews.title: They have a Cadillac Ride in terms of comfort and provide a great grip of the road
customer_reviews.text: The 4000s II 25s lived up to billing... They have a Cadillac Ride in terms of comfort and provide a great grip of the road. I run them at 120 psi because I am a big guy and I am enjoying the ride in said manner.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Continental Grand Prix 4000 S II 700
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I now have these tires on 4 bikes, having removed the tires from brand new bikes, unused, and installed these prior to the first ride. I put these particular tires on my new Ultegra 6800 wheels for an all carbon fiber road bike. They make for a great ride with excellent traction and road adhesion.
customer_reviews.author: Tori Roberts

customer_reviews.title: This is not usual
customer_reviews.text: Brand New tire. Used 2 times. Got 4 flats. 1 flat in the first day, and 3 flats on the second day. it had to be a manufacturer problem as I've always used this type of tire with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Valdecyr Alves

customer_reviews.title: These are as good as they are rated but suggest purchasing the continental ...
customer_reviews.text: I have these same tires on my commuter bike with over 4000 miles and no problems. These are as good as they are rated but suggest purchasing the continental tubes with them. There is no sense in putting an inferior tube with such a great tire. I picked these tires up for half the cost at the local bike shop and got them in 2 days. Very happy with the product and the retailer.
customer_reviews.author: craig dawson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tires, they will give you the confidence to take any turn at high speed!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tires, they will give you the confidence to take any turn at high speed!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great road tire worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: These are great road tires with a harder middle section to hold up mileage, softer sides for cornering, and imprints for grip. A terrific ride as well and very puncture resistant. Worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Haven't gotten a flat yet
customer_reviews.text: I love these tires. After swapping out the stock (Hutchinson Equinox) tires off my road bike and putting these on I haven't gotten a flat yet. They roll great, corner well and are lightweight. They are a struggle to put on for the first time but after some time on the rims, they loosen up and are easy to change. After about 1000 miles on these tires, they are still going strong and have yet to be punctured (knock on wood).
customer_reviews.author: NonFace

customer_reviews.title: recommended by a bike racer
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used very many different tires, but these fit the bill better than the others I've used; smoother ride, less flats; long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Samuels

customer_reviews.title: rolls fast
customer_reviews.text: 250 miles so far and love them. They roll really fast and comfortable, play with the pressure to your weight and comfort level according to roads. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Perez

customer_reviews.title: good tires but do not expect durability as thisd is ...
customer_reviews.text: good tires but do not expect durability as thisd is a soft rubber compound that rides really nice and supple. grip is good once the rubber is broken in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much yes.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the 700c×28 for my road bike...and found out my road bike only has clearance for 700c×25. Bummer. So I threw them on my Fuji Feather fixed gear and they're bad ass. Increased speed and comfort, confidence on turns, and the 28s look like fatties on my slim frame. Now I just need to save up for a pair of 25s for the road bike...
customer_reviews.author: A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great tired with proven track record.
customer_reviews.text: Well you read the reviews. Most are positive. Great fast tires with great punctured resistance.
customer_reviews.author: JCA

customer_reviews.title: Tore after <200miles.
customer_reviews.text: Tore after <200miles. I do regular road riding around the bay area, where they are mostly cycling paths and the roads are decent Have completely no idea how there was a tear in it one day, leading to a flat on my first ride on it.
customer_reviews.author: LINN

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love it always stayed with this brand durable and long mileage
customer_reviews.author: macx2i

customer_reviews.title: Easy Rider
customer_reviews.text: Such amazing rolling resistance that your legs will thank you for it. Riding these for three years without a single puncture over gravelly, rough country roads.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C.

customer_reviews.title: Jury is Still Out
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a great tire but, will need a few (hundred) miles to corroborate the theory! I'm new to street bikes so I can't comment on the ride or handling VS other tires but I can say that one of the tires that came with the bike was ripped by a stone after only 15 miles or so. I have 35 miles on these new tires so far and no issues. I bought this because other reviewers praised the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Buckwalter

customer_reviews.title: Performance meets durability
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this tire for 7 years. I like how it rolls smoothly and is fast yet I never once had a flat. I tried the gator skin before these and they were good, but seemed slow. This is a great mix of function and excellent durability.
customer_reviews.author: Therider01

customer_reviews.title: Best tire for your money
customer_reviews.text: Been riding continental for 5 years now, having just switched to the 700x25. Great riding tire that I run less air pressure in than previous. Very rare to flat with these tires. I ride 5000 + miles a year. These are the best all around tires you can purchase in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: BRIANBURGETT

customer_reviews.title: Buyer tried to hoodwink
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, I ordered the 4000s II. I received a 4000s II box, but the top had been ripped, opened and taped. Inside the 4000s II box was a Grand Prix Polyx Breaker—an inferior tire that costs about half the price.
customer_reviews.author: TJG

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny and a great training tire.
customer_reviews.text: Virtually bullet--proof and long lasting. No flats in 1,000+ miles and still going strong and looking good, and that's on unswept Florida roads with remnants of hurricane trash strewn all over the place. You can run them at any inflation from 75-125 psi and they stay good, no pinch flats and great cornering.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Dangerfield

customer_reviews.title: Best All-Around Tire
customer_reviews.text: This tire does everything well. It rolls smoothly, it corners fast, and it’s really puncture resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. F

customer_reviews.title: Best tires on the market
customer_reviews.text: I replaced original equipment Seca tires with these Conti's. I'm familiar with Conti's from way back. They stick in turns, don't flat, ride smoothly, and track well when wet. What else is there...great tire.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: one of the best tires out there.
customer_reviews.text: my go-to tire for high-performance riding; great ride (especially when paired with latex tubes), and durable for the imperfect roads where i tend to play.
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: Flat Free...just imagine...
customer_reviews.text: Could be the best bike tire race and training on the market. Perfect weight...fast...almost zero flats...had one flat after rolling over a piece of wire....Great price..just ordered 2 more through Amazon...Great performance..flat free..Amazing tire.
customer_reviews.author: bill  lyall

customer_reviews.title: Sidewall tears
customer_reviews.text: Rides smooth, but I have had two tears in the sidewalk within a month, with bits of rubber also flaking off the second tire as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

product_meta.title: Continental Grand Prix 4000 S II Bike Tire
product_meta.description: Continental Grand Prix 4000S II Tires provide the ideal combination of comfort, puncture protection and low rolling resistance.
feature_bullets: BLACK CHILI- Features Continental’s revolutionary Black Chili Compound which reduces rolling resistance by 26% improves grip by 30% and adds 5% more mileage out of your tire.

VECTRAN PROTECTION- Reinforcing and matrix fibers made of Vectran are 5X as strong as steel yet still extremely lightweight and abrasion resistant, protecting your tire from punctures more effectively than two layers of Nylon.
HANDMADE IN GERMANY-Continental has been hand making their tires since 1871, maintaining the integrity of tradition, while evolving with the most advanced technology.
RACING MODEL- The Grand Prix 4000S II is the evolution of Continental's flagship race tire.
DISCREET BEAD- Color coordinate to your bike without losing any of the performance of the BlackChili compound.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
